abstract: Tunisia's Parliament votes overwhelmingly in favor of antiterrorism law, fast-tracking its passage after terrorism attacks in March and June that killed total of 59 tourists; some have expressed concern that legislation may harm human rights efforts that have only begun taking root in country.
lead_paragraph: Tunisia’s Parliament voted overwhelmingly late Friday to pass an antiterrorism law after a pair of devastating attacks against tourists, but critics fear that the new legislation may endanger the country’s hard-won freedoms.

headline.main: Tunisia Passes Antiterror Law After 2 Deadly Attacks
headline.print_headline: Tunisia Passes Antiterror Law After 2 Deadly Attacks

snippet: Tunisia’s Parliament voted overwhelmingly late Friday to pass an antiterrorism law after a pair of devastating attacks against tourists, but critics fear that the new legislation may endanger the country’s hard-won freedoms.
